trans-unit.source: How to create and deploy a cloud service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to create and deploy a cloud service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create and deploy a cloud service using the Quick Create method in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create and deploy a cloud service using the Quick Create method in Azure.

trans-unit.source: How to Create and Deploy a Cloud Service
trans-unit.target: How to Create and Deploy a Cloud Service

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: Azure Preview Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure Preview Portal

trans-unit.source: The Azure portal provides two ways for you to create and deploy a cloud service: **Quick Create** and **Custom Create**.
trans-unit.target: The Azure portal provides two ways for you to create and deploy a cloud service: **Quick Create** and **Custom Create**.

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to use the Quick Create method to create a new cloud service and then use **Upload** to upload and deploy a cloud service package in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to use the Quick Create method to create a new cloud service and then use **Upload** to upload and deploy a cloud service package in Azure.

trans-unit.source: When you use this method, the Azure portal makes available convenient links for completing all requirements as you go.
trans-unit.target: When you use this method, the Azure portal makes available convenient links for completing all requirements as you go.

trans-unit.source: If you're ready to deploy your cloud service when you create it, you can do both at the same time using **Custom Create**.
trans-unit.target: If you're ready to deploy your cloud service when you create it, you can do both at the same time using **Custom Create**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you plan to publish your cloud service from Visual Studio Online (VSO), use Quick Create, and then set up VSO publishing from **Quick Start** or the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you plan to publish your cloud service from Visual Studio Online (VSO), use Quick Create, and then set up VSO publishing from **Quick Start** or the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Continuous Delivery to Azure by Using Visual Studio Online][TFSTutorialForCloudService], or see help for the **Quick Start** page.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Continuous Delivery to Azure by Using Visual Studio Online][TFSTutorialForCloudService], or see help for the **Quick Start** page.

trans-unit.source: Concepts
trans-unit.target: Concepts

trans-unit.source: Three components are required in order to deploy an application as a cloud service in Azure:
trans-unit.target: Three components are required in order to deploy an application as a cloud service in Azure:

trans-unit.source: **Service Definition**
trans-unit.target: **Service Definition**

trans-unit.source: The cloud service definition file (.csdef) defines the service model, including the number of roles.
trans-unit.target: The cloud service definition file (.csdef) defines the service model, including the number of roles.

trans-unit.source: **Service Configuration**
trans-unit.target: **Service Configuration**

trans-unit.source: The cloud service configuration file (.cscfg) provides configuration settings for the cloud service and individual roles, including the number of role instances.
trans-unit.target: The cloud service configuration file (.cscfg) provides configuration settings for the cloud service and individual roles, including the number of role instances.

trans-unit.source: **Service Package**
trans-unit.target: **Service Package**

trans-unit.source: The service package (.cspkg) contains the application code and configurations and the service definition file.
trans-unit.target: The service package (.cspkg) contains the application code and configurations and the service definition file.

trans-unit.source: You can learn more about these and how to create a package [here](cloud-services-model-and-package.md).
trans-unit.target: You can learn more about these and how to create a package [here](cloud-services-model-and-package.md).

trans-unit.source: Prepare your app
trans-unit.target: Prepare your app

trans-unit.source: Before you can deploy a cloud service, you must create the cloud service package (.cspkg) from your application code and a cloud service configuration file (.cscfg).
trans-unit.target: Before you can deploy a cloud service, you must create the cloud service package (.cspkg) from your application code and a cloud service configuration file (.cscfg).

trans-unit.source: The Azure SDK provides tools for preparing these required deployment files.
trans-unit.target: The Azure SDK provides tools for preparing these required deployment files.

trans-unit.source: You can install the SDK from the [Azure Downloads](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/) page, in the language in which you prefer to develop your application code.
trans-unit.target: You can install the SDK from the [Azure Downloads](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/) page, in the language in which you prefer to develop your application code.

trans-unit.source: Three cloud service features require special configurations before you export a service package:
trans-unit.target: Three cloud service features require special configurations before you export a service package:

trans-unit.source: If you want to deploy a cloud service that uses Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) for data encryption, configure your application for SSL.
trans-unit.target: If you want to deploy a cloud service that uses Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) for data encryption, configure your application for SSL.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Configure an SSL Certificate on an HTTPS Endpoint](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ff795779.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Configure an SSL Certificate on an HTTPS Endpoint](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ff795779.aspx).

trans-unit.source: If you want to configure Remote Desktop connections to role instances, configure the roles for Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: If you want to configure Remote Desktop connections to role instances, configure the roles for Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: For more information about preparing the service definition file for remote access, see [Set Up a Remote Desktop Connection for a Role in Azure](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh124107.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about preparing the service definition file for remote access, see [Set Up a Remote Desktop Connection for a Role in Azure](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh124107.aspx).

trans-unit.source: If you want to configure verbose monitoring for your cloud service, enable Azure Diagnostics for the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to configure verbose monitoring for your cloud service, enable Azure Diagnostics for the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: *Minimal monitoring* (the default monitoring level) uses performance counters gathered from the host operating systems for role instances (virtual machines).
trans-unit.target: *Minimal monitoring* (the default monitoring level) uses performance counters gathered from the host operating systems for role instances (virtual machines).

trans-unit.source: "Verbose monitoring* gathers additional metrics based on performance data within the role instances to enable closer analysis of issues that occur during application processing.
trans-unit.target: "Verbose monitoring* gathers additional metrics based on performance data within the role instances to enable closer analysis of issues that occur during application processing.

trans-unit.source: To find out how to enable Azure Diagnostics, see [Enabling Diagnostics in Azure](cloud-services-dotnet-diagnostics.md).
trans-unit.target: To find out how to enable Azure Diagnostics, see [Enabling Diagnostics in Azure](cloud-services-dotnet-diagnostics.md).

trans-unit.source: To create a cloud service with deployments of web roles or worker roles, you must create the service package.
trans-unit.target: To create a cloud service with deployments of web roles or worker roles, you must create the service package.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the files related to the package, see [Set Up a Cloud Service for Azure](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh124108.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the files related to the package, see [Set Up a Cloud Service for Azure](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh124108.aspx).

trans-unit.source: To create the package file, see [Package an Azure Application](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh403979.aspx).
trans-unit.target: To create the package file, see [Package an Azure Application](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/hh403979.aspx).

trans-unit.source: If you are using Visual Studio to develop your application, see [Publishing a Cloud Service using the Azure Tools](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff683672.aspx).
trans-unit.target: If you are using Visual Studio to develop your application, see [Publishing a Cloud Service using the Azure Tools](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff683672.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Before you begin
trans-unit.target: Before you begin

trans-unit.source: If you haven't installed the Azure SDK, click **Install Azure SDK** to open the [Azure Downloads page](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/), and then download the SDK for the language in which you prefer to develop your code.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't installed the Azure SDK, click **Install Azure SDK** to open the [Azure Downloads page](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/), and then download the SDK for the language in which you prefer to develop your code.

trans-unit.source: (You'll have an opportunity to do this later.)
trans-unit.target: (You'll have an opportunity to do this later.)

trans-unit.source: If any role instances require a certificate, create the certificates.
trans-unit.target: If any role instances require a certificate, create the certificates.

trans-unit.source: Cloud services require a .pfx file with a private key.
trans-unit.target: Cloud services require a .pfx file with a private key.

trans-unit.source: You can upload the certificates to Azure as you create and deploy the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: You can upload the certificates to Azure as you create and deploy the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: For information about certificates, see [Manage Certificates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg981929.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For information about certificates, see [Manage Certificates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg981929.aspx).

trans-unit.source: If you plan to deploy the cloud service to an affinity group, create the affinity group.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to deploy the cloud service to an affinity group, create the affinity group.

trans-unit.source: You can use an affinity group to deploy your cloud service and other Azure services to the same location in a region.
trans-unit.target: You can use an affinity group to deploy your cloud service and other Azure services to the same location in a region.

trans-unit.source: You can create the affinity group in the **Networks** area of the Management Portal, on the **Affinity Groups** page.
trans-unit.target: You can create the affinity group in the **Networks** area of the Management Portal, on the **Affinity Groups** page.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Create an Affinity Group in the Management Portal](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj156209.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Create an Affinity Group in the Management Portal](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj156209.aspx).

trans-unit.source: How to: Create a cloud service using Quick Create
trans-unit.target: How to: Create a cloud service using Quick Create

trans-unit.source: In the [Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/), click **New**>**Compute**>**Cloud Service**>**Quick Create**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/), click **New**>**Compute**>**Cloud Service**>**Quick Create**.

trans-unit.source: CloudServices_QuickCreate
trans-unit.target: CloudServices_QuickCreate

trans-unit.source: In **URL**, enter a subdomain name to use in the public URL for accessing your cloud service in production deployments.
trans-unit.target: In **URL**, enter a subdomain name to use in the public URL for accessing your cloud service in production deployments.

trans-unit.source: The URL format for production deployments is: http://*myURL*.cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: The URL format for production deployments is: http://*myURL*.cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: In **Region or Affinity Group**, select the geographic region or affinity group to deploy the cloud service to.
trans-unit.target: In **Region or Affinity Group**, select the geographic region or affinity group to deploy the cloud service to.

trans-unit.source: Select an affinity group if you want to deploy your cloud service to the same location as other Azure services within a region.
trans-unit.target: Select an affinity group if you want to deploy your cloud service to the same location as other Azure services within a region.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create Cloud Service**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create Cloud Service**.

trans-unit.source: CloudServices_Region
trans-unit.target: CloudServices_Region

trans-unit.source: You can monitor the status of the process in the message area at the bottom of the window.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor the status of the process in the message area at the bottom of the window.

trans-unit.source: The **Cloud Services** area opens, with the new cloud service displayed.
trans-unit.target: The **Cloud Services** area opens, with the new cloud service displayed.

trans-unit.source: When the status changes to Created, cloud service creation has completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: When the status changes to Created, cloud service creation has completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: CloudServices_CloudServicesPage
trans-unit.target: CloudServices_CloudServicesPage

trans-unit.source: How to: Upload a certificate for a cloud service
trans-unit.target: How to: Upload a certificate for a cloud service

trans-unit.source: In the [Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/), click **Cloud Services**, click the name of the cloud service, and then click **Certificates**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/), click **Cloud Services**, click the name of the cloud service, and then click **Certificates**.

trans-unit.source: CloudServices_QuickCreate
trans-unit.target: CloudServices_QuickCreate

trans-unit.source: Click either **Upload a certificate** or **Upload**.
trans-unit.target: Click either **Upload a certificate** or **Upload**.

trans-unit.source: In **File**, use **Browse** to select the certificate (.pfx file).
trans-unit.target: In **File**, use **Browse** to select the certificate (.pfx file).

trans-unit.source: In **Password**, enter the private key for the certificate.
trans-unit.target: In **Password**, enter the private key for the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** (checkmark).
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** (checkmark).

trans-unit.source: CloudServices_AddaCertificate
trans-unit.target: CloudServices_AddaCertificate

trans-unit.source: You can watch the progress of the upload in the message area, shown below.
trans-unit.target: You can watch the progress of the upload in the message area, shown below.

trans-unit.source: When the upload completes, the certificate is added to the table.
trans-unit.target: When the upload completes, the certificate is added to the table.

trans-unit.source: In the message area, click OK to close the message.
trans-unit.target: In the message area, click OK to close the message.

trans-unit.source: CloudServices_CertificateProgress
trans-unit.target: CloudServices_CertificateProgress

trans-unit.source: How to: Deploy a cloud service
trans-unit.target: How to: Deploy a cloud service

trans-unit.source: In the [Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/), click **Cloud Services**, click the name of the cloud service, and then click **Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/), click **Cloud Services**, click the name of the cloud service, and then click **Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: The dashboard opens in the Production environment, you could at this point select Staging to deploy your application in the staging environment.
trans-unit.target: The dashboard opens in the Production environment, you could at this point select Staging to deploy your application in the staging environment.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Manage Deployments in Azure](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg433027.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Manage Deployments in Azure](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg433027.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Click either **Upload a new production deployment** or **Upload**.
trans-unit.target: Click either **Upload a new production deployment** or **Upload**.

trans-unit.source: In **Deployment label**, enter a name for the new deployment - for example, MyCloudServicev4.
trans-unit.target: In **Deployment label**, enter a name for the new deployment - for example, MyCloudServicev4.

trans-unit.source: In **Package**, use **Browse** to select the service package file (.cspkg) to use.
trans-unit.target: In **Package**, use **Browse** to select the service package file (.cspkg) to use.

trans-unit.source: In **Configuration**, use **Browse** to select the service configure file (.cscfg) to use.
trans-unit.target: In **Configuration**, use **Browse** to select the service configure file (.cscfg) to use.

trans-unit.source: If the cloud service will include any roles with only one instance, select the **Deploy even if one or more roles contain a single instance** check box to enable the deployment to proceed.
trans-unit.target: If the cloud service will include any roles with only one instance, select the **Deploy even if one or more roles contain a single instance** check box to enable the deployment to proceed.

trans-unit.source: Azure can only guarantee 99.95 percent access to the cloud service during maintenance and service updates if every role has at least two instances.
trans-unit.target: Azure can only guarantee 99.95 percent access to the cloud service during maintenance and service updates if every role has at least two instances.

trans-unit.source: If needed, you can add additional role instances on the **Scale** page after you deploy the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: If needed, you can add additional role instances on the **Scale** page after you deploy the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Service Level Agreements](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/sla/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Service Level Agreements](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/sla/).

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** (checkmark) to begin the cloud service deployment.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** (checkmark) to begin the cloud service deployment.

trans-unit.source: CloudServices_UploadaPackage
trans-unit.target: CloudServices_UploadaPackage

trans-unit.source: You can monitor the status of the deployment in the message area.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor the status of the deployment in the message area.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to hide the message.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to hide the message.

trans-unit.source: CloudServices_UploadProgress
trans-unit.target: CloudServices_UploadProgress

trans-unit.source: Verify your deployment completed successfully
trans-unit.target: Verify your deployment completed successfully

trans-unit.source: Click **Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: The status should show that the service is **Running**.
trans-unit.target: The status should show that the service is **Running**.

trans-unit.source: Under **quick glance**, click the site URL to open your cloud service in a web browser.
trans-unit.target: Under **quick glance**, click the site URL to open your cloud service in a web browser.

trans-unit.source: CloudServices_QuickGlance
trans-unit.target: CloudServices_QuickGlance

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
